result.markdown:
---
title: "Starwars characters"
---



# Introduction

You might not be a Star Wars fan, but you've probably heard of the movie franchise!

## Packages

We will use the **tidyverse** packages for data wrangling and for the data.







## Data

The dataset we will explore is called `starwars`.

# Star Wars characters

## Exercise 1

Glimpse at the starwars data frame.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
glimpse(starwars)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Rows: 87
Columns: 14
$ name       <chr> "Luke Skywalker", "C-3PO", "R2-D2", "Darth Vader", "Leia Or…
$ height     <int> 172, 167, 96, 202, 150, 178, 165, 97, 183, 182, 188, 180, 2…
$ mass       <dbl> 77.0, 75.0, 32.0, 136.0, 49.0, 120.0, 75.0, 32.0, 84.0, 77.…
$ hair_color <chr> "blond", NA, NA, "none", "brown", "brown, grey", "brown", N…
$ skin_color <chr> "fair", "gold", "white, blue", "white", "light", "light", "…
$ eye_color  <chr> "blue", "yellow", "red", "yellow", "brown", "blue", "blue",…
$ birth_year <dbl> 19.0, 112.0, 33.0, 41.9, 19.0, 52.0, 47.0, NA, 24.0, 57.0, …
$ sex        <chr> "male", "none", "none", "male", "female", "male", "female",…
$ gender     <chr> "masculine", "masculine", "masculine", "masculine", "femini…
$ homeworld  <chr> "Tatooine", "Tatooine", "Naboo", "Tatooine", "Alderaan", "T…
$ species    <chr> "Human", "Droid", "Droid", "Human", "Human", "Human", "Huma…
$ films      <list> <"A New Hope", "The Empire Strikes Back", "Return of the J…
$ vehicles   <list> <"Snowspeeder", "Imperial Speeder Bike">, <>, <>, <>, "Imp…
$ starships  <list> <"X-wing", "Imperial shuttle">, <>, <>, "TIE Advanced x1",…
```


:::
:::



## Exercise 2

Modify the following plot to change color the points by gender.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(starwars, aes(x = height, y = mass)) +
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 28 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](3-2-starwars-characters_files/figure-html/scatterplot-gender-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Exercise 3

Modify the following plot to change the color of all points to `"pink"`.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(starwars, aes(x = height, y = mass)) +
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 28 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](3-2-starwars-characters_files/figure-html/scatterplot-pink-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Exercise 4

Add labels for title, x and y axes, and color of points.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(starwars, aes(x = height, y = mass, color = gender)) +
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 28 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](3-2-starwars-characters_files/figure-html/scatterplot-labels-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
